node.title: Kamila Valieva takes fourth place in women's figure skating competition
node.description: Valieva's fourth-place finish allows for a medal ceremony to take place.
node.content: ["Russian teen figure skater Kamila Valieva finished fourth in the women's individual figure skating competition at the Beijing Olympics, days after she was cleared to participate in the Games despite testing positive for a banned drug.\u00a0", "Her Russian Olympic Committee teammates Anna Shcherbakova and Alexandra Trusova took first and second. Japan's Kaori Sakamoto finished in third place.\u00a0", "Valieva's fourth-place finish allows for a podium celebration to take place after the International Olympic Committee said there would be no medal ceremony if she placed in the top three.", "The skater tested positive for a banned heart medication, trimetazidine, in Russia in December, but her test result only came to light last week.\u00a0", "This is a developing story.\u00a0", "Christopher Brito is a social media producer and trending writer for CBS News, focusing on sports and stories that involve issues of race and culture."]
